questions.question: You're redesigning a button. What's your first instinct?

options.text: Make it so beautiful that users will screenshot it and frame it on their wall
Research how users currently interact with similar buttons
Try to rickroll somebody with it

questions.question: When you see a poorly designed website, you think:

options.text: This typography is making my eyes bleed
I bet users can't find what they're looking for..
Thank god for ad-blocker and my custom scripts

questions.question: At a party, you're most likely to:

options.text: Go around silently judging their decoration choiches.
Study how people naturally form conversation groups
Calculate the optimal speaker placement for sound distribution

questions.question: When explaining your work to your mom (or caretaker), you say:

options.text: I make things look pretty on computers
I figure out why people get confused by digital stuff
I tell computers what to do, and sometimes they listen
Apps that make you create an account just to browse
People queuing inefficiently at a self-checkout

ui.title: UI Designer
ui.description: You're a visual wizard! Your brain thinks in pixels, colors, and beautiful interfaces. You see design opportunities everywhere and have strong opinions about kerning.

ux.title: UX Designer
ux.description: You're a user advocate and problem solver! You think about human behavior, pain points, and making experiences delightful. You probably have strong feelings about user journeys.

coding.title: Developer/Coder
coding.description: You're a logic master and digital architect! You think in systems, algorithms, and elegant solutions. You probably dream in code and have strong opinions about semicolons.
